Project Allocation and Statistics

Historical data on project quotas, level distributions, and program statistics

ğŸ“Š Innovation Program Allocation and Statistics

This section provides comprehensive historical data on the allocation of Innovation Program projects across different levels over the years, along with key statistics on program implementation. All information is based on official notices from the Academic Affairs Office of Dongguan University of Technology.

ğŸ“¢ Project Publicity Process

The project publicity phase ensures transparency in the project selection process. After review completion, the university publicizes preliminarily approved projects through multiple channels.

ğŸ¯ Publicity Purpose

Project publicity serves several key functions:

  1. ğŸ” Transparency: Ensures open and fair project selection
  2. âš–ï¸ Accountability: Makes evaluation results publicly accountable
  3. ğŸ† Recognition: Acknowledges successful student teams and faculty advisors
  4. ğŸ“° Information Sharing: Provides visibility into the innovation landscape
  5. ğŸ¤ Conflict Resolution: Allows for objections or corrections before finalization

â±ï¸ Publicity Timeline

A typical publicity process follows this schedule:

StageTimingDuration
Initial Review2-3 weeks after application deadline-
Preliminary ResultsFollowing initial review-
Publicity PeriodAfter preliminary results5-7 working days
Objection HandlingDuring publicity periodCase-dependent
Final ConfirmationAfter publicity period-
Official NotificationWithin 1 week after confirmation-

ğŸ“‹ Publicity Content

Project publicity typically includes:

  • ğŸ“‘ Project Details: ID, title, category, level, and special support status
  • ğŸ‘¥ Team Information: Project leader, team members, and faculty advisors
  • ğŸ“ Project Overview: Brief description, keywords, and expected outcomes

ğŸ“£ Distribution Channels

Information is distributed through:

  1. ğŸ“‹ Official Bulletin Boards: Physical notices in the Academic Affairs building
  2. ğŸŒ University Website: Electronic announcements on the Academic Affairs Office website
  3. ğŸ« College Websites: Announcements on individual college websites
  4. ğŸ’» Innovation Platform: Dedicated project management system
  5. ğŸ“§ Email Notifications: Direct communication with stakeholders

  2. ğŸ” Special support projects were established in 2022, receiving twice the regular funding

ğŸ“Š Funding Utilization

No comprehensive data available yet.

Note: ğŸ’° Funding utilization rate refers to the percentage of allocated funds actually used by projects.

ğŸ”„ Program Implementation Process

The Innovation Program at Dongguan University of Technology comprises four key phases each year:

  1. ğŸ“¢ Project Notification - Announcement of quotas, funding details, and application requirements
  2. ğŸ“‹ Project Publicity - Publication of approved projects, teams, and advisors
  3. ğŸ” Mid-term Assessment - Evaluation of progress and continued funding eligibility
  4. ğŸ Final Acceptance - Final evaluation of project outcomes and completion status

For detailed information on each component, please visit:

  • Application Process
  • Mid-term Requirements
  • Final Acceptance Standards
